text: Kreminna (; ) is a city in the Sievierodonetsk Raion of the Luhansk Oblast of Ukraine. Before 2020, it was the administrative center of the former Kreminna Raion. In March 2022, the pro-Russian mayor Volodymyr Struk who supported Vladimir Putinâ€™s invasion of Ukraine, was found shot dead in the street after having been kidnapped from his home. On 19 April 2022, the city was captured by Russian military forces during the invasion. ==References== Category:Cities in Luhansk Oblast
title: Kreminna
